svg.content: <mxfile host="app.diagrams.net" modified="2021-11-20T14:28:31.564Z" agent="5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/96.0.4664.45 Safari/537.36" etag="8IE29wJZB1CAl72_JofC" version="15.8.3" type="google"><diagram id="6a731a19-8d31-9384-78a2-239565b7b9f0" name="Page-1"></diagram></mxfile>

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 317px; height: 1px; padding-top: 397px; margin-left: 404px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font: Proposition: we can learn from studying history how progress is created and sustained and conversely, how progress is stopped or reversed.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 328px; height: 1px; padding-top: 202px; margin-left: 863px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.font: Proposition: we can discover values, beliefs, norms, and practices that nurture progress. We can create social organizations and structures to accelerate progress on the basis of this knowledge.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 298px; height: 1px; padding-top: 695px; margin-left: 1312px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(255, 255, 255); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Economics
Proposition: we can use tools from economics to measure progress and design policies to accelerate progress .

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 294px; height: 1px; padding-top: 944px; margin-left: 882px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 20px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

font.font: we can design new policies and institutions that sustain and accelerate progress.

div.font:
Progress Studies
How can we accelerate scientific and technological progress?

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 270px; height: 1px; padding-top: 731px; margin-left: 462px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

div.span: Proposition: developing and articulating new philosophy of progress is necessary to adequately respond to critical theorists and postmodernists who deny progress is real and or desirable.
